website_summaries.verdict: A solid pick for those wanting heated flooring in their cat's home to avoid overheating.
pros: Warmer gets only as hot as cat's normal body temperature
Customers appreciate the product's easy assembly
cons: Heating pad is thinner than other K&H products

customer_reviews.title: Not for Outside Unless Sheltered!
customer_reviews.text: I think the information provided is a bit misleading. This heated cat house cannot get wet, so it must be securely sheltered from the elements. We used a tote and cut holes for power cord and entrance to keep the house itself out of the elements and off of the porch floor. We bought a similiar house last year and it last 1 season. See attached photo for our weather barrier. Otherwise it's warm, not hot, zippers together, cozy for kitty or a small dog. Would be good inside as well.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Hennessy

customer_reviews.title: My cat sleeps in it happily
customer_reviews.text: I think he like it. Weather here is not bad at all, I just want to make sure my cat is cozy at night. The pad's heat is very weak if the cat is not in it. I don't know how warm it is when he sleeps in the house, I guess warm enough for the weather here (never freeze).
customer_reviews.author: Yuankai

customer_reviews.title: He didn't like the door flap and we simply left it off
customer_reviews.text: A neighborhood cat started hanging out in our large back yard. We have two indoors cats and bringing him inside was not an option. As the snow storms moved in, I ordered this and had it FAST. He used it throughout the winter and it kept him warm in temperatures that dipped down well below zero F. The heating pad is pressure sensitive and it turns on when he climbs inside. The heat pad covers half the space so he can position himself to get more or less heat and he chooses. He didn't like the door flap and we simply left it off.
customer_reviews.author: SnowKnitty

customer_reviews.title: Our stray cats love this house
customer_reviews.text: Our stray cats love this house. We live in Ohio and keep it on the porch facing the house so it blocks the wind and snow. I thought because there is only one opening they might not like it well as the other heated huts we have with two openings, but they took right to it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pym

customer_reviews.title: One heated house may not be enough once the neighborhood finds out about it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second heated outdoor cat house I've ordered - was finding that other cats were stopping by to use my outdoor cat's house - think this will cut down on the noise. Overall, assembly isn't that much of a problem - just found it difficult to get the zipper to cooperate sometimes - the overall house is sturdy so getting the zipper over two sturdy pieces was interesting - but once assembled, all the cats checked it out and gave the thumbs up - before taking it outside, my four indoor cats took turns sleeping in it.
customer_reviews.author: Paula E Shubat

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed product and misleading heating surface area.
customer_reviews.text: After manipulating this product for an hour just trying to align it per the instructions, it would not line up to even start zipping it. The product video does not depict the actual start, just some person zipping it halfway through. The box instructions don't show actual line up either, just tells you to do it. I'm an intelligent person but this product was poorly designed. Heating pad is razor thin with only half of it containing a hard heating element, This was not disclosed on the product description. Shame on K & H!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Kvool

customer_reviews.title: Thick material, sturdy zippers
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble (just zipper it together). We had a larger heating pad that our outdoor cat was already using, so we put that in instead of the provided pad. Our cat went right in. The cheaper (tan) version was 30 percent cheaper and the same functional product, although the description didn't explicitly state that a heating pad was included (it was). My cat is pudgy and the round hole was large enough and perfect shape for her to fit. Overall, very satisfied- so far. But, it's been one day... I'll come back and re-rate after a few months of weathering.
customer_reviews.author: steepens

customer_reviews.title: Nice house and you can get it with a heated mat.
customer_reviews.text: House is sturdy but probably needs to be in a covered shelter. We purchased an insulated doghouse to put the cat house in just to give an extra layer of protection from the cold. We bought the heated mat also which works great if you have an outlet near by. We cut a small square out of the back of the doghouse so we could plug it up. Easy to asemble and cat stayed it in on cold days and nights. Took the cat 3 or 4 days before he went in it but once he did he went in and out as he chose. The heated mat is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: John Richardson

customer_reviews.title: These shelters are great for ferrel cats!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermo kitty shelter for a ferrel cat that hangs around our house. I actually bought two for two different cats. They seem to really like them. The first one I bought last year I have in the front of my house under a bush and the cat that uses that one has been here ever since. The one I bought last month is in my backyard and the little cat is finally using it to keep warm. Both cats are very timid (probably due to catch and release) and even though I feed them and bought these thermo shelters for them they won’t let me pet them. Just as well I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Aiello

customer_reviews.title: GOOD, STURDY, WARM
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Sturdy, non obtrusive on my front porch for my ferals. Only problem is they won’t go INSIDE! Lolol They sleep on the top! So, I put cardboard boxes back. Who knew? I’m sure some kitties wouldn’t need directions! Mine do and they’re wild so I can’t “show” them how it’s suppose to b done. Maybe b next winter as I’m still working on taming hem . We shall see. I NEVER give up on my kitties!!
customer_reviews.author: Robin H.

customer_reviews.title: Stinks!
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to zip together and has a terrible, strong petroleum based odor that is STILL apparent after two weeks of outgassing. I haven't been able to use it because of the strong smell and don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RAZER

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly after you look at the process before starting ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly after you look at the process before starting and hold materials to alleviate pressure on the zipper. There was a fair amount of rubber-like chemical scent so my cats steered clear of this until I left the back open and ran a fan on it for 6 hours. That seemed to reduce the odor significantly. The heater is pretty warm and the pad is the same height so they can span the two sections of the floor and stay comfortable. I like it- only wish the cats liked it as much!
customer_reviews.author: Wavicle

customer_reviews.title: Easy Zip Tunnel for Winter
customer_reviews.text: I really like this design. I purchased this product to help outdoor wildlife battle cold winter months. I wanted some kind of shelter to help provide some wet and cold protection while looking low profile. The clear door flap is a nice touch to help keep in warmth but could use some improvement. I won’t be using the warming element outdoors but will repurpose it for something else. I advice the sellers/designers of this product to emhance the clear door flap and offer the OPTION to sell just the tunnel not the warming pad to decrease cost.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonLIFE

customer_reviews.title: Does not heat well. Bad odor.
customer_reviews.text: Strong odor. Does not heat enough for being out in below 30* weather. I could barely feel the heat on my hand and it only heats half the bottom section. I ended up duck-taping a cord on a regular heating pad and placed it in a large heavy-duty storage container set above ground and covered container with a blanket and tarp, then put a towel under and over the heating pad - worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Ann W.

customer_reviews.title: Great product but not waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this for a stray cat that I feed and he loves it, he refused to get into it with the flap so that came off quick! I’m up on a second story and when it rains it’s not waterproof I’ve learned my lesson, a regular size kitchen trash bag fits perfectly around the entire house and I set it on top of a big Tupperware bin lid and it works perfect! Lowest it gets here in south La is the 20’s here and there and his outer is cold but underbelly is toasty when I go out to feed him in the mornings!
customer_reviews.author: MELISSA F.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, very sturdy and easy to clean. A hit with Olivia
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly. Pretty easy to assemble. I’m not going to add heat insert until it gets colder. I put an old T-shirt inside instead and sprinkled some catnip. Also taped up flap to keep it open. I have shelter under porch in corner. It fits nicely, I like that it’s not too high big or bulky. Also color blends in nicely with surroundings Looks easy to clean up with a hose or wipe down. After some inspection Olivia made herself right at home.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Cat Wasn't Having It
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Lectro-Soft heated bed in my garage for about three years for my feral cat. I put it in a foam bed and it has been doing a good job. Because we were expecting the temos to be well below freezing, i purchased this house-style bed thinking it would keep him warmer. The actual heated surface is very small, and it's a hard plastic pad. After one night, he refused to use it and slept in his old bed, even though I'd removed the heated pad and the temp dropped to 4 degrees. I think if this house had a pad like the Lectro-Soft, it would be much better.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Just what kitty needed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a covered porch to provide protection and comfort for a neighborhood kitty that has started to visit more often. Although she enjoys it now, it did initially have a very strong chemical smell. I wasn't sure I believed this in other reviews, but it is true. It kept kitty from using it right away. After it aired out for about a week, she tried it and seems to like it. I like the option for kitty to lie on the heated or non heated area. It was relatively easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Cat uses it!
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat hesitant to buy w/only 1 entrance/exit but that was certainly not a problem. As I finished plugging it in the cat came around the corner and immediately went in. A recommendation to the mfr. would to provide openings for the wire on each side of the house instead of only 1 side. I had to cut 1 for my location/orientation of the house due to the length of the wire. Easy enough to plug original hole w/ duct tape but detracts from looks and I feel mfr. should have thought of this & maybe incl. velcro or some suitable way to cover unused hole. But cat likes, so okay.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: bottom has four holes in it
customer_reviews.text: who puts holes in the bottom of an outdoor cat shelter? Seriously 4 holes in the bottom one in each corner.... to do what, screw it down? Water is definitely going to get in. And it stinks really bad... a kind of polyester/plastic smell. Lots of people have mentioned that. Yes it was hard to figure out to zip it, and it didn't zip easy as others have said. It said water resistant, but I have read other reviews that said that it wasn't. This seems pretty worthless to me.
customer_reviews.author: anniedelasol

customer_reviews.title: My kitty loves this house
customer_reviews.text: The only negative for me, is I found it hard to put this together..my husband figured it out. It zips together.. but confusing. But who cares.. it is sturdy and high quality... it looks tasteful and compact.. I wondered if my huge black cat would go in..especially with the plastic flap on the door. Within a few minutes he was inside.. he looked so cute looking out. It was a cold night..the start of winter here. Love this ..now I don't have to worry about him being cold. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Our cat thinks he has to be outside even in extremely cold weather and he cries until we let him out. We wanted to make sure he could warm up so we bought him this house. This shelter is very easy to assemble. The size is perfect for one cat and all you do is zip it in place. Excellent quality product. Our house is on our porch which is porcelain tile so i placed a small piece of plywood under his kitty house. We purchased a second house for our screen porch.
customer_reviews.author: DRE

customer_reviews.title: Miss Kitty loves this
customer_reviews.text: We use this indoors and our cat loves it. We keep the house cooler in winter so she gravitates to it when we are all in the living room together. That way she can keep an eye on us and vice versa. Would recommend it. Have other K and H products that we keep on our covered porch for two of our neighbors cats who seem to appreciate being care for at our house. Have used those products for 5 or 6 years now and they are great.
customer_reviews.author: discerning consumer

customer_reviews.title: Several issues to overcome but overall worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Should come with much better zipper instructions and pictures. It is well made with several construction issues though: 1 - fabric sewn too close to zipper track; 2 - extremely difficult to get zipper started because of rigid edges needing to be folded under while trying to lock in to zip. The smell is so offensive and STRONG I actually had a bad allergy attack; eyes swelling almost shut and nose burning; my cat however, was so anxious for me to put together that he instantly jumped inside as soon as I put it on the floor. Hopefully, the smell abates shortly! That said, I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Sls

customer_reviews.title: The Cat's Meow!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Fantastic! This little hut saved my outdoor cats life this winter. She just loves it! The pad heats up when she lays on it and keeps her nice and warm. She is a feral cat that has picked my shed to live in. So of course I had to feed her. But she won't come near people. Great quality and it gets the job done. The inside mat has a wonderful Sherpa lining. A must have for your feral feline in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice kitty house for our outdoor cat. The pad stays really warm, and it’s pretty well resistant to water. The plastic flap doesn’t close very well in the cold weather because it stiffens up, but it works good enough to keep most of the wind out. It was a little harder to zip up because of the way the zipper is stitched in. My big burly husband had to do it, I’m not sure if I could have done it alone. But my kitty loves it! It was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Hooker

customer_reviews.title: Strong Chemical Smell, after more than 1 week...
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loves this bed, however, I cannot hold her or get near her due to the strong chemical smell on her body. This unit smells terrible still and it has been over a week open, out of packaging and in use. I have had to remove the unit from our porch and I am contacting Amazon to return it even though I do not have the original packaging. We are sad that the unit has such a terrible smell as my kitty loved it. We will search for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl R. Peddle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product!
customer_reviews.text: A stay cat adopted me this fall. I got this house in the hopes that he would go in it to stay warm this winter. I had to take the door off but he went right in. Only a few nights down in the 20's in Oklahoma so far, but this little heated house works great. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Warm and cozy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our two stray and skittish kitties. The minute I put it out on our covered patio they got right in! The previous feral cat crate I made out of a large tote and filled with straw wasn’t touched all last winter. This is just right with the heated pad. The kitties love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Kitty Toasty
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item! I was hesitant to spend the money, but I'm glad I did. We live in Nebraska and it gets COLD in the winter. Our cat goes stir crazy and wants outside. We bought this for him to go into after he roams, and until we let him back in. He loves it. Keeps him warm and toasty. When I let him in , I check his ears, paws and fur ~ all warm, even in single digits.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L Slavick

customer_reviews.title: Keeps them safe from the elements
customer_reviews.text: Nice little place to keep your pet out of the elements, lots of room. If you have kitties that enjoy each other's company, they could both fit inside but the heated part is only on the back half. Only one way in and out. Keep it plugged in and will stay warm for them but it is not very comfortable, you can't add another cushion for their comfort. Keeps them out of the wind,rain and frost though. I wish there was a way to make it more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lesa

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be good cat house.
customer_reviews.text: It took some time to match and get zipper started to put cat house together. I placed it inside a bigger Barn Home dog house (due to construction of material), put Blackie the cat in, he stayed in for a moment and then never went in again. Georgie laid it in for a couple of times. A possum got in it several times and since then no one has been in the cat house. Guess I'll wait until weather gets a lot colder to see if it is utilized. If not, then it was a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I could not engage the zipper to start zipping it up. The cloth at the free end of the zipper was trimmed so close that there was nothing to hold onto as you tried to get the zipper pull to engage with the other half of the zipper. It’s going to be a pain to ship it back. Undecided whether to patch it together with duct tape/ baling wire or throw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Celtic Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this house to put out front and give some of the Ferrel Cats a warm place to hide during the cold nights here in the Northeast. The house zipped together easily and the zippers are stong and well made, the size is perfect for one cat, maybe two if thay are small. The heating elelment is only half the size of the overall house and gives the cat the choice of direct or ambient heat. Overall a very nice little house to help keep my outside friends warm.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Shanahan

customer_reviews.title: Only Half Heated
customer_reviews.text: If I hadn't already thrown away the box, I would have returned this. Chaos was reigning and I didn't get it assembled for a couple of days. Then I realized that only half of the heated floor is actually heated. The cord is too short to allow for much outdoor positioning. Also, for a very large cat, I think it will be an uncomfortably tight fit. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Fillmore

customer_reviews.title: Just ok - bot weatherproof
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that I can't just leave this out in the weather You have to have it in some type of shelter I don't keep my garage door open so that was useless So now it's crammed on my tiny porch where I dont have a plug for the heater. So if it is plugged in you have to make sure you unplug it every day which is rather high maintenance. I wish it was more weatherproof
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Read the description
customer_reviews.text: The heated pad is only HALF the length. Still good and the cat likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Mc

customer_reviews.title: Note that there is NO SECOND DOOR.  Overpriced for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Somehow I managed to select a cat shelter with no second door, no escape door. Most shelters sold have two (and it makes good sense why). I am annoyed that I obviously didn't read carefully and bought this one. I am particularly grumpy about it, because this item also arrived dirty, as if someone else had purchased it, messed it up, returned it. They didn't notice and sent it to me (dirty, with what looks like a dusty boot print on it). I'd send it back, but a cold front is moving in.
customer_reviews.author: Chickpea

customer_reviews.title: Defective heater.
customer_reviews.text: Major issue - the heater does not turn off. I contacted their customer service to get a replacement heater 10 days ago, no reply. Past return date. Otherwise fairly nice, if your cat likes it and you protect it from moisture. Our cat doesn't like it and sleeps in front of its door on a pad at 25 degrees. She will go in to get a treat and come right back out. I think it need a clear flap on the side for looking out and and serve as an emergency exit. It is not waterproof, on a narrow porch I had to put it in a jumbo garbage bag to keep blowing rain and snow off it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Extremely strong, chemical like, petroleum based odor. Heating element doesn't cover the entire floor. No floor padding.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely strong, chemical like, petroleum based odor that is still apparent after sitting on my screened in porch for two weeks. The chemical smell is intense. I can’t imagine allowing any animal to rest or sleep inside this unit while breathing such toxins. I'm sending this unit back despite throwing away all the original packing. Also, the heating element is half as big as the bottom of the unit. Therefore, only half the floor is heated. The heating element is hard plastic. The wool cover for the heating element has zero padding.
customer_reviews.author: Kjo*

customer_reviews.title: Works in theory but not in practice
customer_reviews.text: The design is great but the execution not so much: the heat "plate" just doesn't get that warm, plus it emits a really acrid hot smell. We will have to refit the house (without the heated pad) for use by warming fleece bedding in the dryer before settling the porch cat inside it. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: K. Collins

customer_reviews.title: KITTIES LOVE THIS HOUSE!!
customer_reviews.text: The kitties love this house. I bought it to place inside of a larger dog house for ferals living outside. I always modify everything, so I place a kitty bed with sides inside, and placed a larger bed from another k&h product inside of it. Yahoo, the kitty is happy! Ferals aren't much with the door, so I have one of these with the door on & 2 with the door off. We have 13 ferals which we care for & they all have a K&H product to sleep in or on!
customer_reviews.author: kathanhal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cat Shelter!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shelter for our feral cat. Simple to assemble, large enough for our outdoor cat & sits easily on a table on our porch. It seems sturdy, but would definitely need to be under cover such as a porch. The heating pad is just right. At first the cat just laid on it, but once it turned cold at night, she went right in. Sometimes, on cool raining days, she only comes out to eat & prowl around. She still lays on it at times, but it is definitely something that is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: WV Rural Route Girl

customer_reviews.title: Hard to zip
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this five stars if the instructions were more clear and the darn zipper worked a little better. The bed is soft and warm (25 watts doesn't put out a lot of heat, but a warm cat will) and sits nicely on my side porch for the outside cat I am trying to tame and spay. (four inside cats are not happy about the stranger outside their door) Perfect little house for this little stray.
customer_reviews.author: Hattie Wheatfield

customer_reviews.title: Heated pad doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: After a huge disappointment involving shipping (arrived 2 days late) I finally received the product. We finally got it together but the heated pad doesn't work. Shouldn't I be able to contact K&H for a replacement pad? Well, I can't! I can't find any way to make contact with seller.
customer_reviews.author: Gunru

customer_reviews.title: only half of pads heated ;(
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and seems sturdy enough for purpose of giving shelter to my outdoor cats. I did not like that the heating surface only covers half of the bottom surface. I do not understand the reasoning for this. So if two or three of my cats got in it, only one could lay on the heated pad and the other half is just a pad without heat.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiS

customer_reviews.title: Like it but thin, heating pad not too hot and door does not swing freely
customer_reviews.text: I like this however I'm a little worried about how it will do in the coldest part of winter. The walls and floor seem very thin. (I think I will probably end up throwing a blanket over it on the coldest days.) The heating pad, which I was afraid would get too hot because it said it heats to 104'F, seems to just get warm but not too hot. The clear plastic door (that velcros to the inside of the top of the hole) does not fit very well. My cat has adapted to it but it does not swing freely.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Yaeger

customer_reviews.title: This is good for 'mildly' cool weather
customer_reviews.text: This is good for 'mildly' cool weather. Not very warm for cold weather. Heater is only the back 1/2 of the house. And not very warm. I was a bit disappointed. Limited heat. A bit on the flimsy side. My cat goes in. But she will use it more so in spring and summer. Is Not warm enough for cold weather as I was hoping.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy P

customer_reviews.title: Protective little home for outdoor weather
customer_reviews.text: We had to put one of our cats outside due to ‘too many accidents’... and needed a warm home for her... took me awhile to figure out how to zip top to bottom, but then it works great. The warm bottom that plugs in is nice for cold weather. Took her awhile to use, and now looks adorable looking out the window all cozy inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not water resistant
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My out door cats love if. Please note is is not weather or water proof. The pictures of cats using if in the garden or wooded areas are miss leading So it needs to be lifted off the ground and covered so rain or snow do not dampen and ruin it. With a little imagination and weather proofing, it is a great product to keep you cats sheltered from the elements. From our Kansas cats to yours.
customer_reviews.author: Rat

customer_reviews.title: The shelters are easy to construct
customer_reviews.text: We now have three of these A-frame shelters and our cats who live outside use them all the time, At first they were reluctant to enter, since the "new" smell still remained, but as they began to rub against them, they accepted them. Now they are Home to them. The shelters are easy to construct, having three Velcro strips which secures the side to the bottom. I removed one of the clear plastic doors to assure them that they would not be trapped inside. Thanks, K&H Manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lorrain

customer_reviews.title: Very good product but needs to out-gas!!
customer_reviews.text: A nice little cat home and was easy to put together. It smells VERY strongly of harsh chemicals. I bought it a month ahead of time to put it unassembled outdoors to air out. But my feral cat has yet to go into it after 2 months, even with our way below zero temps in MN. I think he is simply used to sleeping elsewhere and that is his comfort zone. He looks miserable and cold but with plenty of heated food and water in heated bowls, he may survive.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Todd

customer_reviews.title: Blackie loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Yep, it was a little difficult to zip together for me, because my hands are very weak. However, once I finally got it started it was fine. I have it in my garage sitting on a table, and Blackie has called it home. Went down to 39 last night, so I know he is happy to be loved.
customer_reviews.author: Just Shirley

customer_reviews.title: but my boys like it. The structure is very well made and ...
customer_reviews.text: The heating pad seems rather weak, but my boys like it. The structure is very well made and would keep out the elements. Its downside is a very strong rubber odor that does not go away on its own. To deal with the odor, I tried giving all the shelter parts shower and hand washed a healthy dose of my shampoo into the material. Then let it outside over night to dry and it seemed to do the trick. The odor is about 85% gone and seems to slowly get better. Once cleaned my boys started using it on occasion​.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Bad Zipper Tab
customer_reviews.text: The shelter is great. My barn cat loves it. When I attempted to zipper the shelter together the pull tap on the zipper broke off. Needs an all metal zipper tab, not rubber. Used a pair of pliers to pull the zipper all all away around to close the shelter. How much would it have cost the manufacturer to use a metal zipper tab??? Not worth the effort to return for exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Calahan

customer_reviews.title: Wish it were better :(
customer_reviews.text: Very nearly tossed the thing into the lawn trying to put it together. I zipped my fingers into it twice. I understand that it needs to be assembled securely but I question if zippers were the best solution. It also has a very powerful chemical smell that my cat hated. She never once set paw in it.
customer_reviews.author: JasonBason

customer_reviews.title: Blackie loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our deck cat would give it a 5-paws up review. We added a small cut from his favorite blanket and he's good to go. It's so nice to know he has adequate shelter in our rather mild Pacific Northwest winters. We have his 'home' tucked in a sheltered nook on our deck so it and he are protected from rain and wind. Don't know what the resident raccoons think--maybe they're envious.
customer_reviews.author: Smurfkat

customer_reviews.title: Heated cat shelter
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice shelter but the heating element is really hard and the pad that comes with it does not provide enough cushion on the heating element. My cat still gets in it when its cold at night. We didn't even put the door/flap on it because I know my cat would have just ripped it off. Putting together the shelter was a pain because the way the zippers are set up, it makes it hard to put the zippers together and zip. Definitely a two person job!
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble. Sturdy. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: It assembled easily. I had to unzip it to get the heating pad inside. It rezipped with no problem. I place it in a contractor bag to waterproof it as it will be in the rain and snow. It gets cold in Chicago and the contractor bag also acts as additional insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Great Lakes Sailor

customer_reviews.title: My cat - puss puss - gives this 10 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Originally I did not think the cat was going to use this. But after she climbed in one very cold night - she discovered the weight triggered warming plate under her tee tiny frame and now she doesn't even want to come in the house all that often. She loves that I put it up on a 4 ft table right out the back porch so the dog can't torment her. Nor can he drag her bed out to the middle of the lawn. Hooray for K&H.
customer_reviews.author: RebRand

customer_reviews.title: Broken zipper head during first assembly.
customer_reviews.text: While assembling the kennel, the tag portion of the zipper broke off. I had to finish the assembly with a pair of pliers. For the amount of money, I assumed this would be of better quality. I tried to write the company, just to get a 20% discount and keep the item instead of dealing with postage, but Amazon doesn't allow this type of communication. Based on an immediate break, I'm nervous the warmer will eventually break as well. I'd say this item is worth $40...but not the $65 I paid.
customer_reviews.author: D. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Best outdoor protection cats actually use.
customer_reviews.text: Usefulness is the key when in cat rescue. All the shelters I've tried, this one was the one used to most by the feral cats. Heated pad was perfect, no too hot or cold. The electrical cord was perfect throughout the harsh winter and is still holding up well after the 3rd season. There are zipper entries on each end as an emergency exit, however this also creates a draft when entries are on opposite ends. Only drawback was 1 entryway.
customer_reviews.author: Gml

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: Well, he used it once, but doesn’t seem to like it anymore. We bought this to replace a home made setup, but he definitely doesn’t use it like he did the old one. I think that the clear plastic door is the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn A. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: first one great, second one useless
customer_reviews.text: we've had a house working on the front porch for more than a year used in all weather...cats love it. got the recent one because of first. second unit UNZIPS itself repeatedly. useless.
customer_reviews.author: esm

customer_reviews.title: I bougth two separated heated cat houses.  One had two opening and the other had just one.
customer_reviews.text: I returned the one with one opening which I suspect is this one pictured. The cats (that I care for) don't like to have just one opening and won't use it. If it's the one with two opening, it's five star all the way. I'd like to see clear hanging plastic door on it though. The single opening one has one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Orr

customer_reviews.title: Nice warm place for outside kitties.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to assemble. heats up nicely. The only drawback is the heating pad is a bit hard; it does have a fleece cover that pads it somewhat. It fits perfectly in our old Dogloo doghouse. The dog wont use it would it will be a cozy spot for the barn kitty.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara W.

customer_reviews.title: Will. Not. Zip.
customer_reviews.text: Why a zipper? Do you know what zippers don’t do well? Turn corners. And this thing is all corners and curves. I spent an hour trying to zip this thing together unsuccessfully. The zipper either wouldn’t zip or split. It was like an hour of trying to unzip yourself out of a coat. I have no idea if it’s weatherproof or even if the damn thing heats up. Didn’t get that far before I decided to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Iserman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Too hard to zip and zipper actually broke off. This is not worth the money. Also, it is supposed to fit four cats. It looks like only one cat can fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for cats! :)
customer_reviews.text: I can't get my cat out of it. She adores her new heated cat bed. It was definitely a good buy. The initial put together was a little odd, but after figuring out where to zip everything together, it was pretty easy. Also, it doesn't exactly say how the heated pad fits inside, if you fold it in half or just lay it out. In the end I laid it out black side down and had the headed plate to the back. This seems to work, as the cord sized hole fits the cord and the cats love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jae & Kimmi

customer_reviews.title: Our Feline Loved It!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure if she would take to it, but she participated in the assembly and was happy to call it home. We have it in our unheated sun room with a pressure activated heating pad that fits perfectly inside. Couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: kps2008

customer_reviews.title: Nice outdoor cat house for covered area
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice warm cat house for a covered area, perfect for one feral cat. It has a heated fleece floor pad inside (1/2 of the floor is heated, 1/2 is unheated). Since it is made of canvas, I placed it inside a large plastic yard bag and cut out a hole at the opening to the house to make it waterproof in case of blowing rain or snow.
customer_reviews.author: recordman

customer_reviews.title: Cozy bed
customer_reviews.text: I have been raising a stray for 5 months now,he stays in my shed and roams freely on my property in the country. He loves sleeping in his warm bed,this is a plus since it is winter now.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: PURR-fect For Your Fur Babies During Winter Months!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 cats really love these beds during the winter. They each have one. They stay nice & warm. We have them in pens in our metal shop/garage. Convenient to plug them in and must be protected from rain/snow as they are soft sided & the bed insert must be plugged in to heat. Our cats get mad at us when I clean them & store them in the spring!
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilson, TX

customer_reviews.title: Kittys are very comfy in their huts
customer_reviews.text: This is a very very great product. I have two plugged in the extra garage. This garage is insulated but not heated so it gets down to single digits in there. The two strays I bought these for have brought the temperature up to 65 degrees in -30 weather. I added a small wool blanket in the entrance but that’s it. So affordable. I’m So glad I took the chance and bought two.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M.

customer_reviews.title: Cozy & Warm - Just as ordered!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little house! Easy to put together - just be careful and patient, shaping the house as you zip! Our 'porch cat' loves his new home - stays nice and warm when he needs it. The clear plastic door is a little dicey in the fit department, but after repeated tries, we got it installed so it's fairly well closed and yet easy to push open. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CS Font

customer_reviews.title: Well made, durable design
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cat house - built well, durable, strong power cable. My cat likes it too... but apparently not as much as the roof of my Audi. I was kind of hoping he would confine himself to this house for the heat... but he's a cat and knows the one place I really don't want him. I do find him in the house frequently, though and I know the heat is working because of a lighted power adapter I placed at the end of the cord to let confirm power to it at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Matt J.

customer_reviews.title: The Good N The Bad
customer_reviews.text: Bad> it malfunctioned and cooked my cat to death... The Good> He was a nice medium-well and didn't taste to bad! (LOL It woks fine, no assembly. )
customer_reviews.author: I always wait to review

customer_reviews.title: Cats love 'em.
customer_reviews.text: While this product definitely earned five stars for ease of assembly and sturdiness, I'm afraid I had to guess on comfort because try as I might, I couldn't get myself into it. Just didn't fit. My cats love them, though.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Chiweenie
customer_reviews.text: We have a very independent Chiweenie and he loves his little house! We keep it plugged in on our covered deck. It's nice to have a warm place outside for him to get warm after wandering the property!
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Harris

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor kitty loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Our new outdoor kitty loves it. I was not sure if he was using it or not, but I just popped up into the carport rafters, where he decided he likes to hang out, and he was in it up there. Love that it's heated, he came over to me and his belly was nice and warm. I feel much better going into the winter knowing he has a warm house to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Nice homes for my kitties
customer_reviews.text: These are nice. Cats like them but I had to take the plastic flap off in order for them to go in (which was easy to take off). One of the zippers on the house was busted so I can’t use one of them. Wondering if I could still return it?
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Matney

customer_reviews.title: Kitty and I both love
customer_reviews.text: This kept my cat warm during the harsh winter months while I was away at college and my mom decided she was an outdoor only kitty. Michigan winters are brutal but this trusty thing was safe for extended use and kept my baby warm. (She’s an indoor cat now. Do not leave cats outside in winters)
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Gage

customer_reviews.title: This has been perfect for our outside kitty and winter nights
customer_reviews.text: This has been perfect for our outside kitty and winter nights. We hooked it up to our Christmas lights timer so that it only runs for certain times.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't able to use the little plastic door because the cat wouldn't go in there but he seemed to like it just fine without the
customer_reviews.text: A feral cat used this shelter during the snowy winter here in the NE. I wasn't able to use the little plastic door because the cat wouldn't go in there but he seemed to like it just fine without the door. The pad is soft and works for warmth and the only thing I'd like would be a longer power cord.
customer_reviews.author: E Thorn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I like the sturdy construction. I plugged the insertable heating pad into a dusk to dawn timer so it wouldn’t run all day long. Assembly was a bit confusing at first, but it made perfect sense once we found the instructions tucked away into the box it came in. Would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Id Snew

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this thing.
customer_reviews.text: I keep the cat house in my unheated garage, my cat spends 99% of her time in it, she loves it. On cold days she only comes out to eat her soft cat food, and go to the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: N. Spence

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Outdoor Cats
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver through cold Michigan winters. We have an outdoor cat who would sneak in the garage when it was really cold out and leave foot prints all over the car. Now she cuddles in this every day on our covered back porch, even after it started warming up again. She feels safe in this and it is good quality. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Becca D

customer_reviews.title: i'm not impressed with the amount of heat it throws ...
customer_reviews.text: i'm not impressed with the amount of heat it throws off. I didn't notice any difference when i put some weight on the pad (it's supposed to be activated by weight) To say it is warm is very much an understatement. My cat doesn't really go in it.. But it's not cold yet. I bought this for indoor use, becuase my house is too cold in the winter for these little guys!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Keep your outdoor pets warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: I like but I can’t my cats to use it still. I’m not sure but I might need to remove the plastic door on it I think that is the problem but not sure
customer_reviews.author: Christine king

customer_reviews.title: Horrible to zip together
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd read the reviews. It's horrible to put together and when I finally got the initial part of the zipper aligned and started zipping, the zipper split at the beginning all the way to where I was still trying to zip it up.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Nice design
customer_reviews.text: It zips together. KIitty is warm and comfortable. This is not made for outside shelter, so we covered with a plastic trash bag.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Keeps warm. We bought it for a stray cat that we are feeding. The cat has not come close enough to invite inside so this is the best option . We really like the quality and its a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chemical smell is really bad.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our cats. Not easy to assemble. Better instructions would be a big help. Only half the floor is heated by a hard plastic base. But the worst thing is the really strong chemical smell. After a day, the smell is just as strong. Reading other reviews, the smell does not go away. Returning product.
customer_reviews.author: Gene T

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This cat shelter is made great and the pad heats up to a nice warmth, although it has not been cold enough to use the heat just yet. I have one cat that loves to stay outside and now I don't have to be worry about him being cold. He loves to snuggle in his new cat cave and I'm sure he will love the heated pad this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Debora O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: My kitty is safe, warm and happy now
customer_reviews.text: My cat recently decided she preferred outside living. Fine in the summer, but I was worried as fall set in. I ordered this and set it up and she's loving it. I don't feel guilty leaving her outside (on the front porch) and she seems happy and warm. Some of the reviews said it was a tad difficult to set up but I found it quite easy....just make sure to line up the zipper properly.
customer_reviews.author: Mediamaverick

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves her house!
customer_reviews.text: My outdoor kitty loves her new house. It keeps her warm and toasty in the winter. I put a fleece blanket over the top and draped it over the front to provide additional windblock. I have the house on top of a tall table on my back porch for my cat that prefers to live outside. She also uses it in the summer. I just take the heating pad out and placed a blanket inside for her.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: only half the pad is heated, strong smell when ...
customer_reviews.text: only half the pad is heated, strong smell when I first opened it, had to leave it outside for odor to dissipate . Large enough for 2 cats but again, only half the pad is heated.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to assemble cat house...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect home for the ferals I care for. They like it and appreciate the heated pad on cold nights.
customer_reviews.author: scutrone

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. The only downside is that it smelled somewhat ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. The only downside is that it smelled somewhat like chemicals when we got it, but the cat liked it so much, she went in anyway (and she is suspicious of everything). We have 2 barn cats that are short-haired and they love the heating pad. It seems to not get super hot, but when I pull a kitty out of there, their undersides are always warm. Simple assembly, durable material. Very much worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it.
customer_reviews.text: At first my cat didn’t want to go into the shelter. So I removed the window and she went right in. She stays in it when it snows and when the temperature goes down to15-20 degrees. Luckily so far this winter we have had very mild temperatures. But she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Debra McDonald

product_meta.title: K&H Pet Products Mod Thermo-Kitty Heated Shelter Great for Outdoor Cats
product_meta.description: Color:TanSimple Heated Safe Energy efficient The Mod Thermo Kitty Shelter is a simple zip together design The rigid exterior will hold up to any use The extreme weather design keeps outdoor cats warm down to the lowest temperatures mother nature can throw at it Half the floor is heated by a K&H Small Animal Heated Pad so the cat can choose to be on or off the warmth Use in a barn shed porch garage under a deck or anywhere extreme temperatures exist MET listed One year limited
feature_bullets: Remove the cover and wash it on the gentle cycle with cold water Line dry or use the no-heat cycle on your dryer
Great for barn shed porch garage under a deck or anywhere extreme temperatures exist
Remove the cover and wash it on the gentle cycle with cold water Line dry or use the no-heat cycle on your dryer

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
